availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Trigg County Court
November term 14 Novr. 1864

On motion of Wm Baker &C. who made proof to the Satisfaction of the Court that they are merchants in good faith it is ordered that they have a License to Sell Spiritous liquors at their Store at Roaring Spring in quantities provided by law, Whereupon they paid the tax and fees imposed by law,

A Copy
Att C, C, Hooks c, T c, c,
To All Whom It may consern

Mr. W. B. Baker & Co of Roaring Spring Trigg Co Ky is hereby granted Coffee house license one year from date for the consideration of fifty dollars Given under our hands this 15th day of November 1864

D. H. McKennon
F. M Stephens
J. W. Miller
